metadata.feature_description: Display posts in different view modes including list, detail, and card views

steps.action: Navigate to News page containing Publisher module
steps.expected: Publisher module should display with posts in card view format
steps.actual: News page loaded successfully showing Featured section and Latest section with post cards

steps.action: Scroll to view Featured and Latest post sections
steps.expected: Posts should display as cards with image, title, summary, date, and author
steps.actual: Featured post and Latest posts displayed correctly as cards with all metadata visible

steps.action: Click on 'Publisher Test Post' in the Latest section
steps.expected: Should navigate to post detail page with full content
steps.actual: Navigated to detail page at /News/Publisher-Test-Post with breadcrumbs showing 'News > Publisher Test Post'

steps.action: Scroll to view full post content and author section
steps.expected: Detail view should show title, date, full content body, author information, and share buttons
steps.actual: Detail view displayed all elements: title 'Publisher Test Post', date 'January 16, 2026', content body, author section with avatar and 'Written by SuperUser Account', and social share buttons

steps.action: Examine post cards in list view for metadata
steps.expected: Cards should display title, summary, posted date, and author name
steps.actual: Post cards correctly display: title as h2, summary text, 'Posted on [date] by' label with date, and author name

steps.action: Examine post detail view for metadata
steps.expected: Detail view should display title (h1), published date, tags if any, body content, and author bio section
steps.actual: Detail view correctly displays: title as h1, date 'January 16, 2026', full body content, author avatar, 'Written by SuperUser Account', and 'More from this author' link

steps.action: Click 'More from this author' link in post detail view
steps.expected: Should filter posts to show only posts by selected author
steps.actual: Navigated to /News?author=1 and displayed filtered results showing only posts by SuperUser Account (2 posts)

steps.expected: Should show 'Search Results' breadcrumb, filtered posts, and 'Viewing: [author name]' indicator
steps.actual: Page shows 'NEWS > Search Results' breadcrumb, 2 matching posts by SuperUser Account, and 'Viewing: SuperUser Account x' filter indicator with remove option

steps.action: Enter 'Workflow' in the search box and press Enter
steps.expected: Should filter posts containing 'Workflow' in their content
steps.actual: URL changed to /News?text=Workflow and displayed filtered results

steps.expected: Should show only posts matching search term 'Workflow'
steps.actual: Two posts displayed matching search: 'Workflow Test Post - Claude Testing' and 'Test Workflow Post - Submit for Review'

steps.action: Navigate to News page and check for Load More button
steps.expected: Load More button should appear if posts exceed page size
steps.actual: No Load More button displayed because total posts (3) is less than default page size. Code review confirms Load More only appears when PostList.Count() >= PageSize

observations: Code suggests Load More pagination exists (CardViewManager.js line 82-97) but cannot be tested in UI due to insufficient number of published posts (only 3 posts available, which is below the page size threshold)
Code suggests tag filtering exists (Detail.ascx line 24-33, CardViewManager.js line 221-223) but no posts with tags were found in the test environment to verify this functionality
Code suggests infinite scroll style pagination is implemented via 'Load More' button click, not traditional numbered pagination
SEO optimization is implemented: first page of posts is server-side rendered (List.ascx line 27 comment: 'First page is rendered server side for SEO purposes')
The Publisher module uses card view as the primary display mode - no list vs grid toggle was found in the UI or code
Social sharing buttons (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, RSS) are integrated into both list and detail views
